info.title: Event Portal Open API
info.description:
# REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Event Portal provides a RESTful API that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. The REST API allows you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available in the event portal.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single tag by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the tag.

200.description: The single tag.

put.description: Use this API to update a tag.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the tag object to update.

200.description: The updated tag.

delete.description: Use this API to delete a tag. The tag must not be in use by any objects else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the tag.

get.summary: Retrieves the tags of a schema
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the tags of a schema. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema to retrieve the tags.

200.description: An array of tags identified by their tag ID.

put.summary: Updates the tags of a schema.
put.description: Use this API to update all of the tags of a schema. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object to update.

200.description: An array of the updated tags identified by their tag ID.

get.summary: Retrieves the owners of a schema
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the owners of a schema. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema to retrieve the owners.

200.description: An array of owners identified by their user ID.

put.summary: Updates the owners of a schema
put.description: Use this API to update all of the owners of schema. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object to update.

200.description: An array of updated owners identified by their user ID.

get.summary: Retrieves the tags of an event
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the tags of an event. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to retrieve the tags.

200.description: An array of tags identified by their tag ID

put.summary: Updates the tags of an event
put.description: Use this API to update all of the tags of an event. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object to update.

200.description: An array of the updated tags identified by their tag ID.

get.summary: Retrieves the owners of an event
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the owners of an event. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to retrieve the owners.

200.description: An array of owners identified by their user ID.

put.summary: Updates the owners of an event
put.description: Use this API to update all of the owners of an event. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object to update.

200.description: An array of updated owners identified by their user ID.

get.summary: Retrieves the tags of an application
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the tags of an application. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to retrieve the tags.

200.description: An array of tags identified by their tag ID.

put.summary: Updates the tags of an application
put.description: Use this API to update all of the tags of an application. Tags are referenced by their tag ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object to update.

200.description: An array of the updated tags identified by their tag ID

get.summary: Retrieves the owners of an application
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the owners of an application. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to retrieve the owners.

200.description: An array of owners identified by their user ID.

put.summary: Updates the owners of an application
put.description: Use this API to update all the owners of an application. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object to update.

200.description: An array of updated owners identified by their user ID

get.summary: Retrieves the owners of an application domain.
get.description: Use this API to retrieve all of the owners of an application domain. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain to retrieve the owners.

200.description: An array of owners identified by their user ID.

put.summary: Updates the owners of an application domain
put.description: Use this API to update all of the owners of an application domain. Owners are referenced by their user ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain object to update.

200.description: The updated application domain object.

get.summary: Gets Virtual Broker (Logical Event Mesh) objects
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of Virtual Brokers that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of Virtual Brokers to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Virtual Brokers to partially match on.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Broker type for the Virtual Brokers to match on.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: Match only Virtual Brokers with the given names separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only Virtual Brokers with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of virtualBrokers and the accompanying metadata.

post.summary: Creates a Virtual Broker (Logical Event Mesh)
post.description: Use this API to create a Virtual Broker. The Virtual Broker is the virtual representation of the overall topic taxonomy represented by a Logical Event Mesh. It includes the entire tree structure of all the defined Topic Addresses that are associated with it. An Organization may have 1..* Virtual Brokers. An Event can be associated with 1..* Virtual Brokers. Each Virtual Broker address must conform to the given Topic Trees event broker type.

201.description: Created a Virtual Broker. The newly saved Virtual Broker object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of tags that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of tags to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the tag to match on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only tags with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of tags and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Tags can be created to organize the objects of your event-driven architecture. Assign tags to objects to make them easier to group and find.

201.description: Created a tag. The newly saved tag is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of schemas that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of schemas to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the schema to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared schemas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only schemas in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only schemas with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of schemas and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, schemas are a fundamental building block for modelling the payloads of the events flowing through your system. Use this API to create schemas that can later be referenced by events.

requestBody.description: The schema requires a name, an application domain, and a content type (one of XML, JSON, AVRO, Binary, or Text). For JSON, AVRO and XML based schemas, the content field must be populated with a valid JSON schema or XML schema (XSD or DTD). Schema content may be versioned by setting the content field of the schema version object(s); in this case, the schema content field must not be set. Either the schema content field or versions field may be set at one time, not both. A schema should be marked as shared when it is allowed to be used by other application domains. To avoid sharing a schema with other application domains, do not share it. The description field should be populated to describe to other users what the schema is and how it should be used (much like this description you're reading is describing the schema of this API).

201.description: Created a schema. The newly saved schema object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of events that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of events to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event to match on.

parameters.name: topicName
parameters.description: Topic name of the event to match on.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Broker type of the event to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only on shared or unshared events.

parameters.name: schemaId
parameters.description: Match only events which use the given schema.

parameters.name: keySchemaId
parameters.description: Match only events which use the given key schema.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain.

parameters.name: virtualBrokerId
parameters.description: Match only events in the given virtual broker.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only events with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of events and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Events are the primary building block of an event-driven architecture. Applications publish and subscribe to events and events reference schemas. Events are created with a topic that they are published to, and subscribers subscribe to that topic to receive events from the event broker.In the Event Portal, an event is a type of event as opposed to a specific event instance.

requestBody.description: The event requires a name and an application domain ID.

201.description: Created an event. The newly saved event object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of enums that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enums to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the enum to match on.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: Match only enums with the given names separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only enums with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of enums and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Use this API to create an enum. Enums represent a bounded set of acceptable values defined for a topic address level.

requestBody.description: Enums must have a name, Virtual Broker (Logical Event Mesh) type, and a set of values.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of applications that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of applications to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to match on.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only applications in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: applicationClass
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given application class.

200.description: Retrieve a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, applications are a fundamental building block for modelling the producers and consumers of events. Use this API to create applications and model the events they produce and consume.

requestBody.description: Applications have a name and live within an application domain. Events can be added to the application as produced or consumed.

201.description: Created an application. Returns the newly saved application object in the response body.

post.summary: Generates an AsyncApi document from an Event Portal application
post.description: Use this API to generate the AsyncApi document of an application object.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object

requestBody.description: asyncApiVersion: The version of the AsyncApi specification that you want to generate. Currently, we support version 2.0.0.

200.description: Returns the AsyncApi document as a string.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of application domains that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of application domains to get per page. Min: 1 Max: 100

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get. Min: 1

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to be used to match the application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: topicDomain
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given topic domain.

200.description: Retrieve a list of application domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To help keep your event-driven architecture organized, use application domains to create namespaces for your applications, events and schemas.

requestBody.description: Application domains have a name and topic domain.

201.description: Created. The newly saved application domain object is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Retrieves a Virtual Broker (Logical Event Mesh) object
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single Virtual Broker by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Virtual Broker object.

parameters.name: nodes
parameters.description: If True, the topic nodes are retrieved.

200.description: The Virtual Broker object.

delete.summary: Deletes a Virtual Broker (Logical Event Mesh)
delete.description: Use this API to delete a Virtual Broker object. The Virtual Broker must not contain any Topic Addresses otherwise it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Virtual Broker object.

patch.description: Use this API to update a virtualBroker. You only need to specify the fields that needs to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the virtualBroker object to update.

requestBody.description: The virtualBroker object (only the description can be updated).

200.description: The updated virtualBroker object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single schema by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The list of fields to include. This must be a comma-separate list without spaces. The name 'latestContent' is an alias that will fetch the content field if the schema has no versions, otherwise it will contain the content of the latest version.

200.description: The schema object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete a schema. The schema must not be in use by any events else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object.

patch.description: Use this API to update a schema. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object to update.

requestBody.description: The schema object. Either the schema content field or versions field may be set at one time, not both.

200.description: The updated schema object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single event by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object.

200.description: The event object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an event. The event must not be in use by any applications else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object.

patch.description: Use this API to update an event. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object to update.

200.description: The updated event object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single enum by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum object.

200.description: The enum object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an enum.  To delete an enum, it must not be in use by any event's topic address.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum object.

patch.description: Use this API to update an enum. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum object to update.

200.description: The updated enum object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single application by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object.

200.description: The application object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an application. If the application never existed or is already deleted, the operation will still be successful.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Schema application

patch.description: Use this API to update an application. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object to update.

200.description: The updated application object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single application domain by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain object.

200.description: The application domain object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an application domain. This action also deletes all applications, events, and schemas in the application domain. You cannot undo this operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain object.

patch.description: Use this API to update an application domain. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain object.

200.description: The updated application domain object.

description.example: Taxonomy of familiar animals such as dogs and cats.
Schema created by Solace PubSub+ Cloud API documentation

content.example: { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#", "$id": "http://example.com/root.json","type": "object", "title": "An example schema", "required": [ "attribute", ], "properties": { "attribute": { "$id": "#/properties/attribute", "type": "string", "title": "An example of a string based attribute", "examples": [ "aValue" ], "pattern": "^(.*)$" } }}

latestContent.example: (See the example of the content field.)

description.example: Application created by Solace PubSub+ Cloud documentation
Application Domain created by the Solace PubSub+ Cloud API documentation
